title: Time Ripe To Join India's Growth Story: PM To German Business Delegation
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today said this is the right time to join India's growth story, as German Chancellor Olaf Scholz met the Prime Minister in the national capital with a business delegation.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today said this is the right time to join India's growth story, as German Chancellor Olaf Scholz met the Prime Minister in the national capital with a business delegation.

title: Shoplifting Hits Record High, Costing UK Stores Rs 18,347 Crore Last Year
content: Shoplifting in England and Wales hit record levels last year, with nearly 1,300 incidents reported daily, a 29% rise from the previous year, reaching a total of 469,788 offences.
summary: Shoplifting in England and Wales hit record levels last year, with nearly 1,300 incidents reported daily, a 29% rise from the previous year, reaching a total of 469,788 offences.

title: India, China Troops To Disengage At Depsang, Demchok By Month-End: Sources
content: Indian and Chinese troops will complete disengagement - in the Depsang and Demchok areas of Ladakh - and fall back to pre-April 2020 positions by Tuesday, Army sources said this afternoon.
summary: Indian and Chinese troops will complete disengagement - in the Depsang and Demchok areas of Ladakh - and fall back to pre-April 2020 positions by Tuesday, Army sources said this afternoon.

title: Death Of Hezbollah Leader Marked "End Of An Era": Analyst
content: The killing of Hezbollah's powerful leader Hassan Nasrallah a month ago has marked a fundamental shift for the Iran-backed Lebanese movement and revived calls for it to surrender its vast weapons arsenal.
summary: The killing of Hezbollah's powerful leader Hassan Nasrallah a month ago has marked a fundamental shift for the Iran-backed Lebanese movement and revived calls for it to surrender its vast weapons arsenal.

title: Kursk Residents Get Used To Life With Strikes, Sirens
content: When Ukraine launched a ground assault into Russia's Kursk region in August, President Vladimir Putin promised to quickly "dislodge" Kyiv's forces and return normality to local residents.
summary: When Ukraine launched a ground assault into Russia's Kursk region in August, President Vladimir Putin promised to quickly "dislodge" Kyiv's forces and return normality to local residents.

title: "Race Against Time" To Avoid Lebanon "Conflagration": European Union
content: EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell on Friday said the international community must speed up efforts for a political solution to end the fighting in Lebanon and prevent a "conflagration".
summary: EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell on Friday said the international community must speed up efforts for a political solution to end the fighting in Lebanon and prevent a "conflagration".

title: A Looks At North Korea's Military Partners Around The World
content: North Korea has been accused of sending thousands of troops to Russia, potentially to take part in the war in Ukraine.
summary: North Korea has been accused of sending thousands of troops to Russia, potentially to take part in the war in Ukraine.

title: Germany Has Increase Visas For Skilled Indians To 90,000: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday hailed the strengthening ties between India and Germany, citing recent collaborations as evidence of their deepening friendship.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday hailed the strengthening ties between India and Germany, citing recent collaborations as evidence of their deepening friendship.

title: Indo-German Ties Strong Anchor In Times Of Conflict, Uncertainty: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today said the strategic partnership between India and Germany has emerged as a strong anchor at a time when the world is faced with tensions, conflicts and uncertainty.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today said the strategic partnership between India and Germany has emerged as a strong anchor at a time when the world is faced with tensions, conflicts and uncertainty.

title: Mia Khalifa Slammed Online For Mocking US Military Service Members
content: Mia Khalifa has come under fire on social media for mocking US military service members. In a video posted on X, Ms Khalifa said she hoped that US army members get "their little brains all scrambled up" for fighting war overseas.
summary: Mia Khalifa has come under fire on social media for mocking US military service members. In a video posted on X, Ms Khalifa said she hoped that US army members get "their little brains all scrambled up" for fighting war overseas.

title: Beyonce Backs Kamala Harris, Joe Rogan To Interview Donald Trump
content: The US election takes a detour from the swing state circuit to decamp to Texas on Friday as Kamala Harris rallies with pop superstar Beyonce and Donald Trump sits down with the world's biggest podcaster.
summary: The US election takes a detour from the swing state circuit to decamp to Texas on Friday as Kamala Harris rallies with pop superstar Beyonce and Donald Trump sits down with the world's biggest podcaster.

title: Trump 2.0 Haunts World Economy Chiefs Gathering in Washington Before Vote
content: The worlds financial leaders are gathered in Washington, ostensibly to discuss technical stuff: debt, inflation, interest rates. Whats really on their minds is Donald Trump.
summary: The worlds financial leaders are gathered in Washington, ostensibly to discuss technical stuff: debt, inflation, interest rates. Whats really on their minds is Donald Trump.

title: US President Joe Biden To Apologise For Abuse Of Native American Children
content: President Joe Biden said Thursday he will issue a formal apology for the treatment of Native American children who were forcibly removed from their families by the US government and put into an abusive boarding school system.
summary: President Joe Biden said Thursday he will issue a formal apology for the treatment of Native American children who were forcibly removed from their families by the US government and put into an abusive boarding school system.

title: Hong Kong's First Dinosaur Fossils Go On Display
content: The first dinosaur fossils found in Hong Kong, likely from a large dinosaur, were put on display on Friday after they were found on a small, uninhabited outlying island.
summary: The first dinosaur fossils found in Hong Kong, likely from a large dinosaur, were put on display on Friday after they were found on a small, uninhabited outlying island.

title: Explained: How AI Can Fight Sex And Gender Bias In Healthcare
content: From assisting doctors with diagnoses to suggesting advanced treatments, Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming health and medicine.
summary: From assisting doctors with diagnoses to suggesting advanced treatments, Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming health and medicine.

title: Why Some Countries Are Not Picking Sides In Global Conflicts
content: For eight years now, the global economy has been weathering a succession of shocks - from trade conflicts and a pandemic to bloody wars in Ukraine and the Middle East.
summary: For eight years now, the global economy has been weathering a succession of shocks - from trade conflicts and a pandemic to bloody wars in Ukraine and the Middle East.

title: Meta, Google, TikTok Must Face Schools' Addiction Claims, Says US Court
content: Meta Platforms Inc., Google, TikTok and Snap will have to face lawsuits brought by school districts in federal court blaming their "addictive" apps for contributing to a mental health crisis among students.
summary: Meta Platforms Inc., Google, TikTok and Snap will have to face lawsuits brought by school districts in federal court blaming their "addictive" apps for contributing to a mental health crisis among students.

title: Share Owners Don't Count As "Working People": UK PM Keir Starmer
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer says Britons who get additional income from stock holdings don't count as 'working people,' suggesting he's willing to raise taxes on investors.
summary: Prime Minister Keir Starmer says Britons who get additional income from stock holdings don't count as 'working people,' suggesting he's willing to raise taxes on investors.

title: NDTV, Dendy Cinemas Partner For Australia's 1st National Indian Film Festival
content: The National Indian Film Festival of Australia (NIFFA) will be held across seven cities in Australia from February 13-16 2025.
summary: The National Indian Film Festival of Australia (NIFFA) will be held across seven cities in Australia from February 13-16 2025.

title: North Korean Troops Join Russia's War In Ukraine
content: The first units of North Korean troops trained in Russia have been deployed in the Kursk region, a Russian border area, Ukraine's military intelligence service said.
summary: The first units of North Korean troops trained in Russia have been deployed in the Kursk region, a Russian border area, Ukraine's military intelligence service said.
